resources.string: PLEASE DON\'T EVEN CONSIDER CHEATING SIR PLEASE GO AWAY
\'Catcher in the Rye\' (by J.D. Salinger) was published in 1947.
The fictional island that is constantly at war with Blefuscu over the correct way to eat a boiled egg is Lilliput.
The Hunchback of Notre Dame\'s title character is named Quasimoto.
Arthur Conan Doyle created Sherlock Holmes.
Rapunzel is a Grimm fairy tale character named for the fruit her mother craved during pregnancy.
The Nobel Prize for Literature is presented in the Scandinavian city of Copenhagen, Denmark.
A fictional book with between 20,000 and 50,000 words is called a short story.
\'The Great Gatsby\' (by F. Scott Fitzgerald) was written in 1925.
Popular author Roald Dahl wrote \'James and the Giant Peach\'.
Cheating is wrong... are you sure you want to go down that path?
